Text.Value: Then I... I suppose we're on our own. Again. Gods.
They have no reason to obey Gortash anymore. If they rebel, it'll put a dent in Gortash's steel might.
I don't have time for this.
Gond smiles on me this day. Thank you.
We were kept hostage to control our families in the Steel Watch Foundry. To keep them building Gortash's death machines.
I will do everything in my power to help them, you have my word.
This will help me ruin Gortash. I'll help them rebel.
At least you survived. Your father sent me.
I just wish more of us had made it through... But mourning can wait.
They have no reason to obey Gortash anymore. If they rebel, it'll put a dent in Gortash's steel might. They need to know their loved ones are dead.
How do you think I found you to begin with? Your father sent me.

EditorData.logicalname: Received quest to save Iron Throne Hostages

Text.Value: I just wish I wasn't the only one...
They have no reason to obey Gortash anymore. If they rebel, it'll put a dent in Gortash's steel might.
He... he did? Of COURSE he did! I knew it... I knew he would do something...
The Gondians in the Steel Watch Foundry are dead. All of them.
All right. I will help the foundry workers rebel.

EditorData.logicalname: Did not receive quest to save IT hostages/not paladin vengance/devotion

Text.Value: What? No! Nononono NO!
Please. They need to know what happened here.
I just - I - I can't thank you enough. I was certain that place was to be my cold, wet tomb.
Th-thank you again! May Gond's grace guide you!
You - you saved us. Saved us all. I thought it impossible, b-but you DID it!
There were so many of us scattered through that place, to save so many was - it was brilliant. Just brilliant.

Synopsis:
The hostage thanks the player for saving him and/or the other hostages. He will also beg the player to save their families working in the Steelwatch Foundry, giving them the quest if they don't already have it. If the majority of Iron Throne hostages AND the majority of Steelwatch Foundry hostages are saved, they will aid the player by making Steel Watchers on their side for the final battle. Otherwise they won't.

Some variation based on whether the player has already been to the Steelwatch foundry and knows about the Iron Throne hostages, promised to help free the Iron Throne hostages, or doesn't know anything about them.

If enough Iron Throne hostages survived, they should hint the player that they might reward them if they save their families. If not enough Iron Throne hostages survived, they should make it clear that the player will not receive any signifacant reward, other than narrative and thanks.

If EscapedHostage has died, the dialog will trigger by talking to any one of the other surviving Gondians, but a Narrator will talk instead of all of them, as otherwise the permutations are too many. This will be an edge case, as EscapedHostage is very very likely to survive.
